'''''The Fellowship of the Ring
column2: being the first part of The Lord of the Rings''''' is the first of three volumes ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. It is followed by ''[[The Two Towers]]'' and ''[[The Return of the King]]''. ''The Fellowship of the Ring'' was originally released on [[29 July|July 29]]

column1: ==Synopsis==
The volume is divided into two books
column2: Book I and II.

column1: ===Book I===

The first book sets the stage for the adventure and follows [[Frodo Baggins]] as he flees from his home in [[the Shire]] to escape the minions of the Dark Lord [[Sauron]]. Sauron seeks [[the One Ring]] that will allow him to control the Bearers of the nineteen Lower Rings and control the three major races of Middle-earth: the Elves
column2: the Men and the Dwarves. The One Ring has been inherited by Frodo who finds himself unwittingly in the midst of a struggle for world domination.

column1: [[Image:J.R.R. Tolkien - The Fellowship of the Ring.jpg|thumb|<small>Tolkien's preliminary design for the dust-jacket of ''The Fellowship of the Ring''.</small>]]
The beginning of the first chapter in the book begins quite lightly
column2: following on from ''[[The Hobbit]]'' which is more of a childrens story than ''Lord of the Rings''. It begins with [[Bilbo Baggins]] celebrating his 111th (or eleventy first
column4: on the same day that Frodo celebrates his 33rd birthday. (His 'coming of age') At the birthday party
column6: to the surprise of all. Frodo later learns about the ring which he had used to make himself invisible
column7: and also to some of its darker powers.

column1: Heeding the advice of the wizard [[Gandalf]]
column2: Frodo leaves his home
column3: taking the Ring with him. He hopes to reach [[Rivendell]]
column4: where he will be safe from Sauron
column5: and where those wiser than he can decide what to do about the Ring.

column1: In his journey he is accompanied by three [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] friends
column2: [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]
column4: and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]]. From the start they are pursued by Black Riders
column5: the [[Nazgûl|Ringwraith]]s who serve Sauron. Narrowly escaping these and other dangers and meeting other interesting characters en route (e.g
column8: another friend of Gandalf who leads them the rest of the way to Rivendell
column9: through further hardships. Frodo is stabbed upon the mountain of [[Weathertop]] by the chief of the Nazgul
column10: with a 'morgul blade' - as part of the knife stays inside him
column11: he gets sicker on the rest of the journey. They also pass the trolls which had been turned to stone
column12: as is told in the ''[[The Hobbit]]''.

column1: ====Chapters====
{{fotrchapters}}
*'''I - [[A Long-expected Party]]''' - details Bilbo and Frodo's birthday party
column2: chapter ends with Bilbo leaving [[the Shire]]

column1: *'''II - [[The Shadow of the Past]]''' - Gandalf tells Frodo the true nature of the ring
column2: and how it must be taken to Mordor and destroyed. Sam who has been listening at the window

column1: *'''III - [[Three is Company]]''' - Frodo sells [[Bag End]]
column2: and officially is going to move to a house at Crickhollow in the area beyond [[Bucklebury]] in [[Buckland]]
column3: while he actually plans to disappear without causing too much of a fuss. Frodo
column4: Sam and Pippin set out through the South Farthing of the Shire towards Buckland
column5: and encounter a black rider. They also meet [[Gildor]] the elf

column1: *'''IV - [[A Short Cut to Mushrooms]]''' - They meet [[Farmer Maggot]] from taking a short cut
column2: and he gives them some of his prized mushrooms. Merry joins them at the end.

column1: *'''V - [[A Conspiracy Unmasked]]''' - Takes place at Frodo's new house at Crickhollow. The title refers to Frodo about to tell Merry and Pippin about his quest
column2: who he had previously believed not to know about it
column3: and they tell him that they had known much of it all along. They also meet [[Fredegar Bolger|Fatty Bolger]]. Frodo decides to leave the next day through the old forest
column4: as it is an unexpected direction
column5: rather than travelling on the roads.

column1: *'''VI - [[The Old Forest]]''' - Although trying to avoid it
column2: the hobbits get lost and travel to the River Withywindle
column3: the "queerest part of the whole wood". Merry and Pippin are trapped inside [[Old Man Willow]]
column4: and are freed only when [[Tom Bombadil]] arrives.

column1: *'''VII - [[In the House of Tom Bombadil]]''' - Tom knows much about the Hobbits
column2: and even tries on the Ring
column3: yet it does not have any effect on him - it does not make him invisible. Frodo tries on the ring then to see if it 'works'
column4: and Tom Bombadil is also able to see Frodo while he has the ring on.

column1: *'''VIII - [[Fog on the Barrow-downs]]''' - Travelling through the [[Barrow-downs]]
column2: the hobbits are imprisoned by Barrow-wights
column3: where they are rescued again by Tom Bombadil. The hobbits are given daggers from the treasure in one of the downs.

column1: *'''IX - [[At the Sign of the Prancing Pony]]''' - The Hobbits reach [[the Prancing Pony]] inn at Bree
column2: where Frodo uses a false name
column4: after singing a song on a table
column5: he trips and accidentally puts the ring on his finger

column1: *'''X - [[Strider (chapter)|Strider]]''' - Strider who had at first seemed menacing
column2: turns out to be friendly. The innkeeper
column4: gives Frodo a letter from Gandalf
column5: which tells him that Strider is a friend of Gandalf's whose real name is Aragorn.

column1: *'''XI - [[A Knife in the Dark]]''' - The hobbits with Strider set out from Bree on foot after their horses had bolted when Black Riders arrived at the inn at night
column2: who had also attacked the beds which they were supposed to be staying in
column3: though Strider had them stay in another room. They buy a pony from Bill Ferny. They pass through the [[Midgewater Marshes]]
column4: and reach Weathertop. There they are attacked by five black riders
column5: Frodo puts on the ring to escape them
column6: and is stabbed in the arm by one of them.

column1: *'''XII - [[Flight to the Ford]]''' - They pass the stone trolls
column2: turned to stone in ''The Hobbit''. Eventually
column3: they meet the Elf [[Glorfindel]] from Rivendell
column4: who takes Frodo with him back to Rivendell on his [[Asfaloth|white horse]]. The riders are washed away in a flood over the Ford.

column1: ===Book II===
Book II chronicles Frodo's stay at Rivendell
column2: where a plan is hatched to destroy the Ring in [[Mordor]]. At first Frodo meets his uncle [[Bilbo Baggins]] who he had not seen since he left Hobbiton much earlier. Frodo sets forth from Rivendell with eight companions: two Men
column4: son of the Steward of the land of [[Gondor]]; an Elven prince
column5: [[Legolas]]; Frodo's old friend and powerful wizard
column6: Gandalf; [[Gimli]] the Dwarf; and Frodo's original three hobbit companions.  These Nine Walkers were chosen to represent all the free races of Middle-earth and as a balance to the Nine Riders.  They were also accompanied by [[Bill the Pony]]
column7: whom Strider and the Hobbits acquired in Bree as a pack horse.  Their attempt to cross the [[Misty Mountains]] is foiled by heavy snow
column8: so they are forced to take a path under the mountains via [[Moria]]
column10: now full of [[Orcs]] and other evil creatures
column11: where Gandalf falls into the abyss after battling a [[Balrogs|Balrog]].

column1: The remaining eight members of the Fellowship then spend some time in the elf-haven of [[Lothlórien]]
column2: where they receive [[Gifts of Galadriel|gifts]] from the elf queen [[Galadriel]] that in many cases prove useful later in the quest. They leave Lórien by river
column3: but Frodo begins to realize the Ring is having a malevolent effect on some members of the party
column5: who tries to take the ring from Frodo. In the process
column6: Frodo puts on the ring to escape him. Later Boromir is attacked by orcs while trying to defend Merry and Pippin. This book ends when Frodo and Sam depart secretly for [[Mordor]] and the Fellowship of the Ring dissolves.

column1: ====Chapters====
*'''I - [[Many Meetings]]''' - After awakening from a sleep for four days
column2: Frodo meets Gandalf and Bilbo again
column3: as well as [[Glóin]] the dwarf from ''The Hobbit''

column1: *'''II - [[The Council of Elrond]]''' - A council attended by many people; Gandalf tells the story of his escape from Saruman; they decide that the ring must be destroyed and Frodo offers to take it to Mordor.
*'''III - [[The Ring goes South]]''' - The nine members of the fellowship travel south through [[Eregion|Hollin]]; they try to take the road over the mountain Caradhras but are forced to turn back.
*'''IV - [[A Journey in the Dark]]''' - They travel to the gates of Moria
column2: where they have to deal with a sea creature in the lake in front of it. Gandalf eventually opens the doors using a magic word. They reach the tomb of [[Balin]].

column1: *'''V - [[The Bridge of Khazad-dûm]]''' - Attacked by orcs and trolls
column2: the Fellowship tries to make their way to the bridge of Khazad-dum
column3: but Gandalf falls during a confrontation with a [[Durin's Bane|Balrog]] on the bridge.

column1: *'''VI - [[Lothlórien (chapter)|Lothlórien]]''' - The company meets the elves of Lothlórien. The elves reluctantly agree to let Gimli the dwarf pass. Haldir takes Frodo to the hill of [[Cerin Amroth]].
*'''VII - [[The Mirror of Galadriel]]''' - The company meets [[Celeborn]] and [[Galadriel]]. Frodo is shown the mirror of Galadriel.
*'''VIII - [[Farewell to Lórien]]''' - The elves give them cloaks
column2: elf bread and other gifts; they leave Lothlórien on boats down the Great River.

column1: *'''IX - [[The Great River]]''' - they notice Gollum following them down the river on a log; they reach the falls of Rauros
column2: where they must choose between travelling on the east or west bank of the river to pass the falls.

column1: *'''X - [[The Breaking of the Fellowship]]''' - They arrive at the lawn of Parth Galen; they still face the choice of whether to go east or west; Boromir tries to take the Ring from Frodo
column2: who puts it on to escape him; Other members of the company split up trying to find Frodo. Frodo and Sam go across the river and head east.
